goal_name: 15. Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss
target_name: 15.7 Take urgent action to end poaching and trafficking of protected species of flora and fauna and address both demand and supply of illegal wildlife products
indicator_name1: 15.7.1.2 Number of permits issued for the export and import of animals and plants, their parts and derivatives that fall under the CITES Convention
organization_name: State Agency for Environmental Protection and Forestry under the Government of the KRU, Department of Conservation of Protected Areas
contact_name: Turdumatov Talantbek Kubanychbekovich, Musaev Almaz Mustafaevich
definitions:
Prevention of poaching and smuggling of protected species of fauna.
Identification and suppression of poaching and illegal trafficking of wildlife. 
Determines the percentage of animal species regulated by the CITES Convention that have become objects of poaching or illicit trafficking to the total number of species of the corresponding classes living in the republic.
concepts:
Poaching – facts of violations of environmental management/ all types of illegal hunting, and the production of hunting using prohibited fishing gear.
The CITES Convention is a convention on International trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora, signed on March 3, 1973 in Washington.
rationale_interpretation: The indicator is formed on the basis of data obtained from materials on the identification of poaching with damage to certain species of wild animals, the trade of which is regulated by the CITES Convention.
data_sources: Information from departmental reports of authorized government agencies responsible for identifying and suppressing poaching, bringing violators (poachers) to justice, and monitoring the implementation of the CITES Convention.
data_collection: The method of data collection is the interdepartmental exchange of relevant information at the request of interested parties.
computation_methods: Sampling of data from available sources.
comments_limitations: The completeness of the information received depends on the careful and regular implementation of security measures, improving the interdepartmental interaction of special authorized bodies, whose activities are related to the regulation of the use and trade of wildlife.
quality_assurance: The competence of authorized persons in the reliable determination of the species/subspecies composition of animals subjected to illegal extraction or trade.
data_availability_gaps: The data is available to interested parties on the websites of specialized bodies, in relevant country reports on biodiversity conservation and compliance with the CITES Convention.
international_comparability: It is a national indicator corresponding to the global indicator 15.7.1. The proportion of wild animals that are the object of poaching or illegal trafficking for species that are traded.
references_documentation: The indicator is formed according to the UNECE Guidelines "Environmental Indicators and Assessment Reports based on them", and the methodology of the SDG indicators, based on available data and consultations.
